So the objective here was very simple.
We just wanted to monitor or measure the tire noise emanating from the pavement.
But before we move on, I want to discuss a little bit about the material that's commonly used in the state of Arizona.
We call it asphalt rubber.
That's the name of the binder or the beitchman it is comprised of two components, just a regular beitchman, paving grade asphalt 80% and 20% ground tire rubber.
Just those two components is a very common surface in Arizona and what we'll be talking about here is the asphalt rubber asphalt concrete friction course.
It's a very thin wearing surface.

Just very quickly, our program in the in the United States vary from state to state, but in the state of Arizona where I live, we pay a small fee when we buy new tires to recycle the old ones so the fee goes to the recycling process.
And I'll just walk you through that quickly.
Collected granulated into a powder.
The steel in fiber is removed in the process through magnets, an aspiration system or a vacuum system.
So you end up with a granulates rubber that's very pure with respect to the absence of steel and fiber.
So 100% ground tire rubber.
It's about less than two millimeters.
In size.
There's some equipment that's used to combine the solid rubber component in the liquid bitumen component.
So these are blending units, and there's all kinds of different manufacturers and configurations, but the concept is the same.
They added scrap tire, rubber and a super sack, which is near a one ton one ton bag.
That's added to the hopper.
It's weighed accurately, weighed and then metered into the into a blending tank.
Combined with the liquid asphalt.
And what they're trying to do here is is allow the rubber to absorb the lighter fractions in the asphalt.
And here you can see the concept of the rubber particle swelling.
Here it's just a side view.
You can see the rubber is unresolved and it remains a very hearty and robust component in the end result pavement.
This material is used predominantly in the Southwestern United States.
Recent research is taking place.

State of Washington and also some recent applications have taken place in New Jersey and.
In Massachusetts.

Particularly overtime.
What my colleague Krishna is working on at Arizona State.

Generation in place in the field.
